description: Must get the the Dutch roll. Must!  These are amazing sandwiches, and I can't wait to go back. The Sandlot and the Freak were amazing, and I'll get them again, but can't wait for something new.
author: Joel C.

description:
"Corner store in a Deli...or Deli in a corner store?"

It's hard to say what the main attraction is here, but I'm betting it's the sandwiches. There's usually a least a few people hanging out by the chips waiting for their sandwiches to be made.

And the sandwiches are good! Definitely the craft cocktail equivalent of a sandwich. All of the meats are hand carved, individually toasted or heated up ingredients, and the bread isn't just some bag of stuff they got from Safeway down the street. You get a decent size sandwich too.

As for the corner store selection, they have pretty much everything you need. Ice cream, wine, household stuff, muffins, etc. Most stuff has a price listed. Aside than the chips, could never figure that one out.

Service is fine. Sometimes they have two guys making sandwiches during the busy times. Only downside is sometimes they close the sandwich shop down early. There's also a tip line on the receipt, which is strange if you're just buying a pack of gum, but hey if you're feeling tipsy go for it.

Overall it's convenient. And the sandwiches are pretty good quality. Just come in at a normal time and you'll be fine.

PROTIP: There is a frequent sandwich program. Buy 10 or so and get one free.
author: Joel L.

description:
Great neighborhood spot on the corner near our house! They have a great wine and beer selection and the prices are good! They also have mostly everything I need when I forgets something during my weekly grocery run. 

Haven't tried the sandwiches yet but definitely gonna be back soon after reading the reviews. We had just eaten dinner hut the fresh baked bread when we walked inside smelled sooooo delicious.
author: Bethany M.

description: We stopped here for lunch after walking through Presidio and were so happy with our sandwiches. We got the sandlot and the escape from Alcatraz. Sandwiches are big! Plenty to share one. They have so many options on the menu and create your own. We had one on the sour dough roll and one on the Dutch crunch and both were fantastic! All of their sandwiches have interesting sauces and combinations. I would definitely go back! They're also right outside of presidio and close to the palace theater and the water so it's a great place to pick up sandwiches for a picnic!
author: Casey B.

description: I have no hesitation writing it's the best sandwich in the Marina. Swing by and grab a "San Franpsycho" or a "Darlicious" and make sure to get it on Dutch Crunch. The sizes are more than enough to fill you up-- perfect to throw in your backpack before hitting Crissy Field or taking off on a hike in the Headlands.
author: Cody W.

description: I see why this deli is so highly rated. Orders two sandwiches out of their long list of types of sandwiches, and both were delicious!
author: Mary G.

description: Had the escape from alcatraz on Dutch crunch (I did sub rotisserie chicken for the buffalo chicken) and it was awesome! Guys making the sandwich were very friendly. I would definitely recommend this place to grab a sandwich.
author: Frank C.

description: Delicious. Ton of variety. Big Sandwiches. Will come back again.
author: Laurie E.

description:
Best hidden sandwich spot in the Marina area. Stop in for a delicious freshly made sandwich and be prepared to be impressed. Their menu has TONS of mouthwatering options - it's my go to weekend lunch spot.

Located right outside the Presido easily grab lunch and head to the water or up to inspiration point and enjoy lunch with a view.
author: Greg V.

description: Delicious assortment of hearty-portioned sandwiches from guys who spend a lot of time honing their craft. I think they must have at least 40 different types of signature sandwiches up on their boards. The guys here work fast and are very friendly. Great value for money, too.
author: Jim P.

description:
Best sandwich in America...so far.
+50 to choose from & a genuine 'sandwich enthusiast' serving them up. Eat here.
author: Alex R.

description: Our group was looking for a good sandwich on a late summer afternoon. Very glad we chose Golden Gate Market. Got a turkey sub and the pesto pasta salad and could not have been happier. The cramped little store had real charm too. As someone who was just visiting the city, this deli made me wish our city had something similar.
author: Matt J.

description: Hands down the best sandwich is SF. I'm hesitant to write this review because I don't want the line to get any longer, but these guys deserve the praise
author: Troy N.

description: I often do a sandwich dance on my way to Golden Gate deli. This place makes me so happy, not just because it reminds me of my college town liquor store's name, but because their sandwiches and chip selection is off the charts. It's a 'Boar's Head' deli, which from what I understand is some sort of chain that nestles itself inside urban liquor stores throughout the city. The sandwiches are amazing and the staff is great too! Definitely a Saturday afternoon treat though because you'll be spending north of $20 for chips, a sandwich (HUGE) and a drink.
author: Maureen L.

description:
I love the sammiches here. Prolly best in the area. They even have a rewards plan. Buy 10 get the next sammich free. I referred my coworkers and their friends to this place. Hot or cold sammiches. 

Pro tip: call ahead in advance to have your sammich for pick up.
author: Pickle R.

description:
5 stars - no, it's not a Michelin star restaurant, but if you want a deli sandwich then it would be difficult to find a better option than Golden Gate!

I hit this place up every weekend - my favorites are the Honey Baked, Sandlot, San Franpsycho and Rest in Pesto.  It's the same Boars Head menu as the popular Boy's Deli on Polk, but lines are shorter and their sandwich construction is much neater (don't you hate it when the wrapping is soaked in sauce by the time you sit down?).  They're also great with call-ahead orders and have a loyalty program (one free sando after 10 purchases).
author: Jason X.

description:
Amazing Value
So much meat, veggies, dressing =)
Soooo goooood
author: Evan Q.

description:
If you're a fan of a good ol deli style sandwich, this might be the best sandwich spot in the marina/cow hollow area. No joke. Super unassuming given its location and corner store feel, Golden Gate has mastered 30+ types of sandos. 

They only use Boars Head meats (which is the highest quality), and have a great selection of assorted breads. I'd recommend the Dutch crunch or wheat. I'm pretty sure all of their "house" sandwiches come toasted, but make sure they throw yours in the oven too. The Darlicous is probably my favorite and go to when I'm in a hurry. Solid. 

You'll usually find a pretty long line at lunchtime, but note that they make sandwiches until 8pm so dinner applies here too :) Make a stop here before heading into the Presidio and have yourself a picnic in the park!
author: Benjamin F.

description:
SUCH a great hidden sandwich spot in the city! Amazing selection of sandwiches, are you can create your own.

I got the SanFranPsycho, which is turkey, bacon, pesto, some spreads, and toppings. On Dutch Crunch, which is always the best. It was really good, but a tad too much sauce for me. My sister made her own, with turkey AND prosciutto, extra pesto, and all the toppings. We shared both our sandwiches, and I liked hers better.

Either way, it's a great spot to pick up a sandwich and I will definitely be coming here again.
author: Jenna G.

description: I loved my San Franphycho sandwich so much! Great place to grab a quick bite. Staff was friendly.
author: Cesare D.

description: Stellar sandwich! The Darlicious with everything on Dutch crunch. Friendly staff with good suggestions and quick service. Great for stocking up for a nearby picnic! Great beer and chips selection too!
author: David K.

description: Best sandwiches hands down, tons of options and quality ingredients Amazingly nice staff. Couldn't recommend this place enough, it's a hidden gem in SF
author: Dilon M.

description:
This place is really tasty! I've been getting sandwiches there for almost 2 years and this place is never disappointing! I always recommend this place to friends and family. Their menu has a lot of options and if nothing fits your craving, you can create your own sandwich. They carry Boar's Head deli meats. 
Aside from their sandwiches, they have a great wine selection and you can find many at reasonable prices.
author: Julissa B.

description:
Located right outside the Presidio gates, this place looks plain on the outside... but it's a party on the inside. They have your standard liquor store fare: chips, candy, drinks, etc. But the true gem are the sandwiches.

Stand in line, order, wait, get your sandwich, go around the other side of the wines to go stand in line @ the front of the store. 

They have a ton of sandwich creations - or you can create your own. Just get the dutch crunch. I've had the San Franpsycho only - and it's been great every time. There is a lot going on in the sandwich so you can feel overwhelmed at first, but.... it's amazing. 

If you're going to go for lunch, try to get there before 12:15 PM, or else the line will be out the door.
author: Shelley K.

description:
We stopped in a couple times this weekend...once for a quick snack run and a second time to try the amazing deli sandwiches!

Service is awesome. Everyone we encountered there was super friendly and patient with the customers, even during their busy lunch rush when there was a line. You can smell the fresh bread when you walk in and then you get a look at the menu board and you're in sandwich heaven. Choose one of their many combos or make your own. They don't skip on the meats and the sauces add so much flavor! Try the sides....the creamy pesto pasta salad is fabulous. 

The wine selection is huge and I love that they carry some unique snacks and candies that I usually only see in specialty shops.
author: Suzanne Q.

description: The sandwiches here are amazing!  Everyone who works here is super friendly, especially Nate!  This is my favorite spot for all sorts of delicious snacks and sandwiches.
author: Lisa B.

description: Great sandwiches. I had the Italian on Dutch crunch. Then went to the great lawn at Presidio and ate them on the big red chairs. San Francisco at its best.
author: Don P.

description: Great selection of food items, sandwiches, wine, and (to my delight) protein bars! Very close to my hotel (Inn at Golden Gate) and I appreciated their hours as well. Very polite clerks.
author: Edwin R.

description: I'm a vegetarian, so got the Veggie Lovers sandwich with garlic spread and honey mustard. Delicious!! Been there many times because of this sandwich!
author: Shelly B.

description:
Best deli (la bodega) in SF. I Always get two sandwiches here, because the san franpsycho is #1. It can get pretty loud in there with 40 different sandwich combos screaming at me everytime. The sandwiches are perfectly crafted, and are nothing less than amazing. 

The potato salad, the pesto pasta salad, the meat ravioli and everything else you need does the trick everytime. 

This spot is a must once a week visit from me.
author: Rafael R.

description: This Market just happened to be somewhat within walking distance from the Palace of The Fine Arts, so we walked there to browse. No one greeted us, they had no hot coffee, no one ever spoke to us, or asked if we would like to purchase from the deli. We literally walked around the very small store, we asked questions, received very short answers, and never felt welcomed, or treated like customers. Very strange business and the gentlemen that work there also. They are definitely not in business to please their customers or make money. We should have just walked over to the Presidio instead. I would not recommend this place.
author: E D.

description:
This place is a hidden gem hard by the Presidio Gate.  It's unassuming and doesn't look like much from the outside.  But, they make oversized sandwiches filled up with premium Boar's Head meats.   

And get it all on a Dutch Crunch roll.
author: David D.

description:
Ordered a turkey pepper jack sandwich on sourdough bread and it was one of the best sandwiches I've had in quite awhile. They do a great job with the bread (toasted) on this rainy day. Will definitely be coming here again and trying a speciality sandwich.

The wait time was short and they had great service.
author: Jessie F.

description:
I work very close by so suffice it to say we get sandwiches from this place in the office often.  There's not really much to say though.  Sandwiches are amazing, location is thankfully convenient, and the guys that run the place are very friendly.  For the quality of sandwich they provide, the pricing is right on the money as well.  My only qualm is the fact that you can't see a menu of their sandwiches unless you went down there.  However, I solved that by snapping some pics and uploading them on here so YOU'RE WELCOME. 

Come here for your sandwich needs and you will be pleasantly surprised by this seemingly unassuming liquor store.  Hell grab your sandwiches/drinks and head over to the Presidio for an easy picnic.

Love it.
author: Chris C.

description: Hidden gem indeed! Great variety of spicy sandwiches. Great staff. Awesome sandwiches. I like them better than Ike's, personally...maybe it's the Dutch Crunch.
author: branden b.

description:
Reu-Benny. HOOO-LYYY S**T. That sandwich hit the damn spot! There was only one guy making the sandwiches, and there was a line. The guy didn't necessarily NEED the help but certainly could have used it. Still, I took that sandwich back to my hotel and devoured that thing. (I would've stayed and ate at their picnic tables, but I was pre-gaming... Can't be seen drinking hard liquor in public like a drunk, ya' know!)

As for the rest of the store it's definitely a good place to grab meals on the run. Huge chip and drink selection, as well as liquor behind the counter. Everything was priced reasonably enough.
author: John H.

description:
I often do last minute sandwich orders from this place, and the staff is always quick, friendly, and accommodating. Plus they keep Kinder Bueno and Happy Hippos right on their front counter! 

Pretty good sandwich selection for meat lovers, however, I am eliminating a star due to the lack of adequate vegetarian options - they have such a huge meat selection, and some of us veggies get pretty bored with avocado, lettuce, and tomato sandwiches. Add some squash, sweet potato, and sprouts to the menu and I'd probably give a 5-star :)
author: Ashley R.

description: Best deli sandwiches in the marina. They automatically toast them so be sure and tell them if you want it cold. My favorite is a standard cold turkey sandwich with everything and pepper jack cheese. They have upwards of 30 different sandwiches on the wall as well.
author: Jared R.

description: Smaller liquor store friendly cashier and very affordable prices with good variety of liquor. Clean and fully stocked what else could you want?!
author: Christine V.

description:
Great selection of delicious sandwiches, many with unusual ingredients. They usually toast their sandwiches. I'm a fan of the Spitfire sandwich, m'self. 

I remember coming here twenty years ago, and even back then, they had great sandwiches.
author: Robert F.

description: Ordered skinny jeans sandwich with turkey, avocado, tomato, lettuce, cucumber, but instead of avocado got onions, pickles and jalapeños. How hard is it to put the right ingredients?! Oh, and the bread was burned from the oven too.
author: Natalie M.

description:
I've lived near this place for 3 years, going in once in a while for smokes or the odd convenience store thing. I never thought it would have some of the best sandwiches in the city. They toast the bread and meat together, which I don't normally prefer, but the veggies were still fresh after a ride home, so it was perfect.

Standard choices of bread/rolls, for an Italian deli, and a large meat selection (some hot). Typical cheese choices with some exotics as well, e.g. chipotle jack. Boars head and Molinari's cold cuts. Bread was also high quality.
author: George P.

description: My favorite spot to grab a sandwich in the city and head to the beach!! Usually never a long wait, fresh bread, and Boars Head meat!! I like to make my own sandwich: turkey and havarti on Dutch Crunch, pesto, lettuce, onions, pepperoncini, and the special Remoulade sauce that comes on the SanFranPsycho...I love that it is toasted too! There is a little outdoor patio too if you want to eat it there.
author: Melissa G.

description:
What's
Not to
Like about a
Liquor store that
Sells good sandwiches right by Presidio.
author: Justin L.

description: Awesome sandwiches!!!!!!!!! Will deff recommend to looking for a great sandwich!!! Sandwich was full of flavor and was nice and hot from the toaster.
author: Nick T.

description:
Awesome selection of sandwiches, each one made to order. Boar's Head meat, great selection of bread, the sides are alright but they have plenty of drink and chip options as well.

These guys work their asses off during the lunch rush and are always awesome. There's often a line crowding the store around 12pm. I try to get there around 11:30 to beat the crowd. Any other time I've been in there it's quiet as a mouse. 


Side note: they have a killer wine selection, standard booze choices and they have a few bottles hanging out in the freezer for a quick grab. Also beyond your basic liquor store groceries available, so if you need something they very well might have it.
author: Mason S.

description:
How have I managed to work in the Presidio for four months and only just find out about this place? If my boss hadn't announced a craving for sandwiches for the weekly meeting - instead of pizza - I still might not know about it. 

Love the sandwich menu - I'm slowly working my way through it (eating the "Rated R" as I type this!). Love the fact that I can pick up some fresh groceries on my way home, too (oops, did I forget an avocado for the salad? Sorted!) The guys behind the counter are always polite and sometimes even crack a smile if you're nice to 'em. And they have Bundaberg ginger beer, which ices the cake as far as I'm concerned. 

I'm told they're planning to start offering delivery later in 2015, which would be great - no more staggering back to my office with lunch for half a dozen people. 

And is it me, or is a scruffed-up version of Ben Stiller working the cash register? Srsly, the resemblance is pretty strong. 

Great place for lunch, go try it. :)
author: Johanna M.

description:
I live nearby and stop by here often after work. It's a great little store that has a variety of options, including a great wine selection. I love that they have healthy snacks available, including fresh fruits and gluten free items. 

Their sandwiches are awesome, as well as their deli sides. The staff is also very kind!
author: Hayley N.

description: I love this place!!! I accidentally found it on a lunch break one day and have been hooked ever since.My fave is "one of the boys" sandwich but I'm enjoying all the fresh sandwiches they have.Highly recommended!!!
author: Harriet A.

description: GREAT sandwiches but BAD BAD ATTITUDE.  there are 2 Latinos that work there  and they are the rudest people! As a Latino a experienced 2 times already that when they are helping other non LATINO costumers, they are very nice to them, but when they help me, the guys was arrogant and mean. My staff that works at a near hotel have told me the same thing about them and they decided not to go anymore. We always recommend to our high end guests to go there when they want a good sandwich but I already told my staff not to send them anymore.  The owners and or the register guys are super nice and friendly. today 1/10/16 my employee went to buy 5 sandwiches and they came and told me again that the Latino guys was so mean to him again. my sandwich bread was like charcoal (over toasted) I think this is it and I'm over this place!!!!
author: Leonardo G.

description:
I work nearby at LDAC and this sandwich shop is my go-to lunch spot. As a matter of fact, I might have quit my job if this deli wasn't here. 

Their sandwiches are fairly priced and always on point;  well toasted with right combination of fresh ingredients. Over the last few months my favorites have beenThe Skinny Girl, The City Boy , Hot Pastrami and Tuna Salad. The sandwiches are the perfect size- they leave you feeling satisfied but not heavy and lethargic. 

Since the place has become very popular, sometimes if you go there at Lunch time there will be a long line. BUT NO WORRIES, the line goes by really quickly and is totally worth it!

The guys that run the place are the best. While working efficiently, they greet you with a smile, make a few jokes, and remember your preferences. For example, they remember I like my sando extra toasted so they always leave it in the oven a bit longer. Its a real nice touch. 

Next time you are in the Presidio, come here, grab a sandwich and some refreshing beverage, and sit down on a bench or under a tree for a lunch that is sure to make the rest of your day better.
author: Felipe C.

description: Great sandwich place! Loved my sandwich. I had San franpsycho (my spelling might be wrong, but something like this) and it was so flavorful! Also huge size. Great customer service, very friendly and professional. Another plus- walking distance from The Palace of Fine Arts. Great place to have your lunch or dinner. Definitely recommend. Their menu has big selection. Something for everyone!
author: Ksenia K.

description: Solid sandwiches, nice staff and a good selection of your basic needs
author: Brendan K.

description: Amazing sandwiches. Might be best in SF. Don't tell anyone. Stay away, so the line stays kinda short, and don't use my trick of calling in ahead of time.
author: Jeremy H.

description: Don't know if this place can be considered a "local secret" with so many reviews. The staff has always been courteous to me and the sandwiches are ridiculous. One of my favorite spots when I'm feeling like a lazy piece of crap and don't want to cook.
author: Andrew B.

description: Staying in the motel next door this little place is a godsend! Great selection of beer and snacks! The guy behind the counter is really cool, friendly and remembered me after one visit. Truly a "neighborhood" store.
author: Randy C.

description: Sandwiches are the bomb! There's a wide selection of beverages, alcoholic and non. Nice people, and great Greek food as well. The baklava is so tasty!
author: Evanthia K.

description: Just came through the rain to get a Sandwich ... First Time in San Francisco for vacation ... I got the San Franpsycho ... It was Amazing ... Best Sandwich I ever had
author: Christian J.

description: This place has new ownership and makes fabulous sandwiches! Clean, friendly and great selection. I'm converted.
author: Michelle T.

description: A hole in the wall spot, but my go to place for phenomenal sandwiches. Seriously, I've tried just about every sandwich, haven't found one I don't like. The SanFran Psycho would probably be my favorite. If you are a regular get a punch card so you can get your 11th one free.
author: Tara M.

description:
What a hidden gem. Especially in times of great hunger and thirst.

They have a fantastic beer selection. I got a bottle of Anderson Valley Poleeko Gold Pale Ale. I am excited this in my 'hood, as I will definitely be stopping near here for some fancy beer findings.

There are lots of cool combos of sandwiches. I got the San Franpsycho, which had some maple turkey, gouda, garlic and remoulade sauce. Good stuff. Huge aslo. Had enough for two meals.
author: Sam D.

description: Great sandwiches, but the absolute WORST ATTITUDE behind the counter. There are two guys who make the sandwhiches seem to just hate their life and take it out on the customers.The experiences I have had here all involved consistent rude and condescending behavior. Beyond enraged, I created this Yelp account. However it does not appear this will do anything considering there appears to be similar complaints below with no changes made.
author: Sean K.

description: Whoa, watch out Ike's and Yellow Sub, this hole in the wall makes KILLER hot and cold sandwiches. Plus great craft beer selection. What a discovery!
author: Peter H.

description: Amazing spot for an inexpensive sandwich! Always go there before a ball game or a long drive out of the curry.
author: Michael A.

description: Really great lunch sandwiches. Service was quick and pleasant, even with a long line. I had limited time for lunch, in this place the bill. Would eat here more often if it were my town.
author: Chris V.

description:
Better story.

First yelp in 2010 didn't tell you anything. It also gave three stars.

Second yelp in 2014 will tell you the super friendly staff makes excellent sandwiches with rotisserie chicken, bbq sauce, tomatoes and shredded lettuce on a toasted wheat roll.

Very reasonable $7 and one bite later this second yelp will also give five stars.
author: Jason B.

description: This USED to be the spot for sandwiches. The Latin gentlemen making sandwiches  is not only rude and seems as if he does not want to be where he's at but he also picks and chooses who to be attentive too, highly unprofessional. I've been here numerous times, recommended this please and the feed back I hear is same attitude but the sandwiches are good. This store is no longer getting my business and I will definitely pass the word along. Zero stars if it was possible.
author: Edward F.

description: Just stumbled on this place yesterday as I was in mood for a deli. Did have time to check yelp. Let the friendly sandwich maker chose for me since there was so much selection he chose the San Franphyscp or something like that. Best deli sandwich I have ever had can't wait to take my husband back.
author: helene e.

description: These guys make AWESOME sandwiches!   My girlfriend and I wandered in after walking up from the Palace of Fine Arts and got two amazing, fresh hand made sandwiches. Plus the two guys who worked there were really friendly and nice. We highly recommend these folks for a wonderful sandwich on the run.
author: Bryan W.

description:
Not only are the men who work here handsome funny and kind they make a mean sandwich.The essence of pure man is obvious from the moment you walk in to the moment you bite into that delicious, juicy, meaty sandwich that has the right amount of crunch to satisfy your texture taste buds.
A friend showed me this spot said they were the best in the area I was doubtful because It was in a liquor store but boy was I wrong! I could hang out there all day and eat their sandwiches. Better then Ike's and sexier.
Also reasonably priced. Makes you feel at home with a real neighborhood vibe. Sandwich so good makes you want to smack babies so be warned.
author: Jessica S.

description:
Really great service deli. Cashier is very friendly and prompt with customers.

Ordered 4 turkey avocado sandwiches from the specials to go. Also got two large orange sodas. Took them to the 49ers vs. Bears game at Candlestick Park, and they were clutch.

I would definitely patron this place again.
author: Nancy F.

description: Love this place. The Deli in the back makes great sandwiches and salads. They are famous for their breakfast burritos but they stop making them at 10am :( they have local fresh organic produce and healthy alternatives. They carry yerba mate and kombucha drinks. Stop by here before you take your significant other on a picnic.
author: Roman J.

description: Amazing sandwiches! A contender with Morucci's in Walnut Creek! Emil and Wally are great!! The Sausalito turkey is hands down one of the best!
author: Cecilia Y.

description: Dam good sandwiches . On a mission to try em all. Haven't been disappointed yet
author: Joe O.

description: Love this place for a killer sandwich and friendly people. There are so many different sandwiches to choose from. And there are benches outside!
author: Ashley B.

description: Night and day from the previous owner. Thankfully these guys have the right idea by actually making the sandwiches and toasting.
author: William B.

description: What a hidden gem in the Marina/Cow Hollow district! What appears to be your average SF market is home to a deli cranking out some of the best sandwiches I've ever had! The sandwiches are HUGE and they don't do 1/2 sandwiches but trust me, you'll want to save the other half for later! They toast all the sandwiches and pile it high with quality meats and cheeses and condiments. The dutch crunch bread is awesome. The guys are always super friendly and it's a great place to grab a quick lunch!
author: Katie S.

description: Hard to say anything that hasn't already been said about these guys, but the sandwiches are effing legit. The guys that work here are also quite chill. Get the Darlicious.
author: Evel K.

description: Great sandwiches!  They shred the lettuce, east coast style, and the bread is warmed and toasted.  I highly recommend the deli for anyone wanting to grab a picnic lunch or quick sandwich!!
author: Kristen R.

description: Great sandwiches! They are nice people and let you switch stuff up. I love to get the San FranPsycho but replace the bacon with avocado. The pasta salad was good too. Super nice guys! I wish they were open later.
author: M B.

description: We stumbled upon this place on the way to the Disney museum. The sandwiches are great! Don't miss it!
author: Paula P.

description: maybe the best sandwiches in the city, been going here for a year now and never been disappointed, local homies always behind the counter are nice too
author: jackson m.

description:
What a great hidden gem!  Made a stop for a sandwich during a walk around the city, it was well worth it too!

It is a market so there isn't any seating but the pizzeria next door had some picnic tables outside that we sat to eat our lunch.  Had a cheese sandwich which was a very enjoyable first.   They load up the sandwiches so you can always save the other half for later.
author: Allie S K.

description: Great spot! Huge selection of sandwiches for reasonable prices. Lines are short and sandwiches are always tasty. And a nice selection alcohol to add. Try the san franpyscho thank me later
author: Michael P.

description:
Since I worked at the exploratorium, and I only had a choice between eating at the Exploratorium Cafe (very pricey) and taking the bus down to Chestnut (I'll be late to work) a co-worker told me about this place.

The guy at the register seems like a nice guy, I always see him chatting with customers while they wait for their sandwiches. I've tried their Turkey and avocado Sandwhich, I was surprised at how HUGE it was and how fresh it tasted. Next, I tried the Veggie sandwich, and again, I was satisfied. 

The only thing that kinda grosses me out is when I look at their display of tuna and ravioli and other foods. They look like they've been there for a while, and I'm scared to try them out. So I'm sticking to the sandwich.
author: Sophia G.

description: For what it is, Golden Gate Market & Deli is really pretty great. Totally decent sandwiches at a reasonable price with plenty of other snack and beverage choices to go with it. I've visited several times and am always met with friendly, personable service and an overall pleasant experience. I recommend the Golden Gate and Ranch Chicken sandwiches as they are quite delectable. :-)
author: Lance H.

description: Great sandwiches, fair prices, good people
author: Larry M.

description:
A liquor store that is also a deli.

These are HULK sized sandwhiches.  The meat is packed on.  Prices are great for the quantity.  Everything is fresh, and selection is good. There's nothing that really stands out for me about this deli, but I would definately make this one of my regular cheap eats if I was a local.  Not sure if this place is open late, but if it was, it would be a great place when you get the munchies ;)

If you want a monster sandwhich (you could definately split one with someone if you're not too hungy) for spare change, this is your place.
author: Amy L.

description: So freaking delicious. I have eaten plenty of sandwiches around SF (Ike's, Yellow Submarine, Sandwich Spot, Sub Center, you name it), and I gotta say this place is probably one of my favorites. The bread is delicious, perfectly toasted, meat and veggies are incredibly fresh. Line can get sort of long during the lunch hour (LDAC employees), but it still manages to move pretty fast. Cannot stress what a find this place is, if you are in the area definitely give it a try. Beats eating LDAC cafeteria food any day of the week!
author: Tyson T.

description: The sandwiches here are amazing..fresh ingredients, fresh bread. friendly service... The only complaint I have is that this store is not near my house, but I think that's a good thing because the sandwiches are addicting...I will come back soon and try another sandwich.
author: Saad E.

description:
The part of Cow Hollow that backs up on the Presidio is so adorable I just want to eat it right up. Of all the nooks and crannies in the city, this little corner is idyllic and fairly full-service. A Travelodge, a vacuum repair shop, a few bars and restaurants, a dentist, a holistic healer.

And of course a functional neighborhood must have a liquor store, and these lucky people have the Golden Gate. (Lucky because they live at Lombard and Lyon, not that the store is especially out of the ordinary.) 
It's pretty standard; a good place to pick up a bottle of water after running the Lyon street stairs, or enhance your Curbside French-bistro experience with a pack of cigarettes. 

They also have a giant flashing red arrow pointing toward their front door, mounted on the bay window above. I always think about the people living upstairs, who've maybe decorated their perfect little living room in Pottery Barn and can't just sit in there and read without the constant flashing red light. I almost feel bad for them, except for being in the lucky bastard club: the top 0.01% of people who can afford to live in Cow Hollow. Oh, the irony.
author: Megan W.

description: Ok. I've had better. This place is more of a liquor store that sells sandwiches on the side.  Not to mention microwave burritos. Whatever!
author: David K.

description:
Walking by doesn't look like much, but I had just checked in to Travelodge next door and needed a bite to eat. I saw the sandwich menu on the outside, and thought it sounded better than pizza at the time. 
I ordered the turkey and avocado sandwich. When I got to my room I was surprised how much meat was on the sandwich. The guy who made it for me was extremely nice, and had good customer service. I figured since they were about to close he just gave me the last of the meat for the night. The sandwich was very tasty!
Went back again during the day this time before I left the area. Different person working and same amount of turkey. They are not skimpy with the goods. Generous with the avocado! Fresh & tasted great. If I'm in the area again I'm going back for another!!
author: Sarah G.

description:
Good solid all around sandwiches.  
Nothing that will blow your mind, but a homey sandwich.  
Imagine you make the best sandwich you can at home, nice ingredients, good bread from the bakery, throw it together, and bam, you have a bite from Golden Gate Deli.  

It's great for this area since there's not much around for a good price unless you head into the marina. 

Price-Cheap-5 bucks total with tax
Roast beef on Dutch Crunch is what I had today.  Solid.  Fresh and healthy. 

My Score
The other ingredients in the deli looked old and browned.  For example, the chicken or tuna salad.  
I'm going to grab sandwiches here more often since I live near by.  I'll probably up my star rating the more I go in.
author: Chase F.

description: great liquor store.  wally emil and nick are all amazing  this store reminds me of another store on polk  hmmmmmm i forgot the name    oh ya   polk and green market featuring The BOYS' DELI . YA YA   thats the 1.  what a great deli that is.   anyhow  golden gate market and deli is one of the best stores around. you just can't beat emil excellent customer service and good looks. what a charming bastard.   i love wally too  he excites me every time i walk in.  keep it up over their guys you are doing great. meow. lol.
author: Nick D.

description:
Hidden jem of the marina!  Seriously the BEST sandwiches ever!!  they are HUGE, fresh and packed with meat...best part, they are under 7 bucks!!  You can grab a sandwich and bag of chips, and head down to the presidio or Chrissy field and enjoy!  I sometimes add in a beer to spice things up!  Every time I have a guest over for the weekend I take them there, they are always apprehensive, and ALWAYS end up going back the next day!

Their booze prices are a little steep, but they are just in line with most the liquor stores and small stores in the area!

My only suggestion to the owners....get thirty packs of keystone light! Even if Im the only customer, i guarantee me and my roommates would be buying you out regularly.....you can take me out of Chico, but you cant take the Keystone light out of my blood!!!
author: Dillon G.

description: Aziz has greatly improved his sandwich making and is now in the Elite Sandwich Making Club with Audrey and Randy.  Congratulations, Aziz.
author: Angela N.

description:
I love Golden Gate Deli.

Deli Sandwiches are a staple in my lunch break, so I am always looking for a good deli near the Presidio within walking distance. Marina Deli is good, but it takes a solid 13 min to walk each way which is too long for a 30 min lunch break.

Golden Gate however, is only 4 min away and much cheaper then Marina. Sam, the owner greats me every time saying, "Hello young man, sandwhich today?". 

Golden gate won't knock your socks off, but its everything I want in a corner deli and liquor store. Enjoy.
author: Brian C.

description:
Other reviewers have commented about this little liquor store; sure, it's pretty normal.  The couple that runs it is impossibly nice.  But here's what everyone else is missing: the cheapest sandwiches a 5 square mile area.  And they're good---not grainy-gourmet-bread-good, but quality-ingredients-made-with-love-good.  
It opens up a whole new realm of possibilities of activities in Cow Hollow (maybe more so if you, like me, live around the corner from this place).  
-Get you're $3.50 sandwich, add a drink, walk down to the Palace of Fine Arts.  Eat on the grass.  Bring a cute girl/guy.  Hey, it's an insta-date!
-Hey, is it early October?  Grab your sandwich and head down to the waterfront to watch the Redbull AirRaces and the Blue Angels.  Oh, and that guy in the Oracle biplane that keeps doing the same thing over and over and over again.  
-Work in the Presidio?  You lucky bastard.  Come here for lunch.  Don't ever let me hear you complain.  
-Is that 12 year old nephew visiting?  Grab that sandwich and head to the Exploratorium.  Hell, bring that cute girl too.
author: N D.

description: this spot has an exceptional deli with reasonable prices. I've been coming to this deli for awhile and the new guys have really improved on Sams old school deli. cheers!
author: justin r.
